item.title: gElemental
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: gElemental is a periodic table viewer derived from GPeriodic that provides detailed information on the chemical elements. It uses the GTK+ toolkit and is available for Linux and other GTK+ platforms. It also provides Python bindings to the data, which is stored in a separate data library.

item.title: Almond
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: ALMOND is a program specifically developed for generating and handling alignment independent descriptors called GRIND (GRid INdependent Descriptors). These are a new generation of 3D-molecular descriptors with application in 3D-QSAR, QSAR, virtual screening, design of combinatorial libraries, selectivity studies and in any field where 3D quantitative pharmacophoric description for (macro)molecules is needed.

item.title: Bioclipse
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: Bioclipse is a Java-based visual platform for chemo- and bioinformatics with a plugin architecture that currently includes plugins for the CDK and Jmol.

item.title: GRID
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: GRID is a computational procedure for determining energetically favourable binding sites on molecules of known structure. It may be used to study individual molecules such as drugs, molecular arrays such as membranes or crystals, and macromolecules such as proteins, nucleic acids, glycoproteins or polysaccharides.

item.title: Frowns
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: Frowns is a chemoinformatics toolkit geared toward rapid development of chemistry-related algorithms.

item.title: Babel
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: Babel is a program designed to interconvert a number of file formats used in molecular modeling. Babel is capable of assigning hybridization, bond order, and connectivity when these elements are not present in the input file.

item.title: Open Babel
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: Open Babel is a chemical toolbox designed to speak the many languages of chemical data. It's an open, collaborative project allowing anyone to search, convert, analyze, or store data from molecular modeling, chemistry, solid-state materials, biochemistry, or related areas. It provides a command-line interface (babel), a programming library (libopenbabel), as well as bindings to several languages such as Python, Perl, Ruby and Java.

item.title: Chemistry Development Kit (CDK)
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: The Chemistry Development Kit (CDK) are Java utility classes for chemoinformatics and computational chemistry. These classes include descriptor calculation, 2D structure layout, graph algorithms, and chemical file format readers among others.

item.title: NMRShiftDB server
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: The NMRShiftDB server is open source software which can be used to maintain a local repository of the results of NMR experiments. This software was developed for the NMRShiftDB database, an open-source, open-access, open-submission, open-content web database for chemical structures and their associated nuclear magnetic resonance data.

item.title: ChemNomParse
item.dc:creator: linux4chemistry
item.description: ChemNomParse is a chemical nomenclature parser. The project aims to build molecules from an IUPAC chemical name.
